intro: Pterocypsela indica var. laciniata, commonly known as the Indian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, bract-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodland or disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
